<color=#ece5d8>Yilong Wharf</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> At Huang the Third's invitation, you arrive at the legendary place where the treasure of the Guhua Clan is located, Wangshan Hall...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Hold it, you two!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Huh...? What is it?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
I behold your immaculate appearance, with eyes as bright as shining stars/your extraordinary beauty, a divinity in this mortal world, and know from this one glance that you nobly wander this land. Therefore, prithee tarry a while, as I make so bold to request your good name?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Not bad. You've got good eyes for some old guy!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, your breathtaking confidence is a rarity. I have certainly not erred!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
What in the world are you banging on about... You too, Traveler! Don't let a few compliments go to your head!
Ahem, anyway, Paimon at your service. He's/She's Traveler. And you are...?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Huh? Are you talking to me?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Precisely! I perceived your uncommon demeanor with one glance. You must also be an itinerant hero/heroine, are you not?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Er, dunno about any itinerant whatevers. But anyway, Paimon, at your service. He's/She's Traveler. And you are...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Ah, yes. Where are my manners? Huang the Third of the Guhua Clan, at your service. Some people know me as the Cloudpiercing Arrow.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Cloudpiercing Arrow...? So you're a talented archer?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it was just a moniker bestowed on me in my youth. Pay it no mind.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Oh, so you're Huang the Third! The one they call the Cloudpiercing Arrow...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hey, don't tell Paimon you've heard of this guy!?
Wait a minute, did you just say... Guhua Clan?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Oh? Are you familiar with our clan's name?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>It rings a bell.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Now, where did I hear about it...?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Excellent, excellent! I thought the Clan's fortunes had waned so much that its name was now all but forgotten. I did not expect you to be so well-informed.
To be frank, I approached you because I am inviting select interested parties to visit Wangshan Hall, our Clan stronghold, and explore history itself.
If you have nowhere pressing to be, how about coming with me to see the Hall? I promise you won't be disappointed!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>You're turning your stronghold into a tourist attraction?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Err... Well, our disciples are scattered all over Liyue. As the Hall is currently deserted, what better time to invite guests?
What's more, it contains treasures never before seen...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>I'm not all that interested...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
I see... Alas! Would it not be a shame if the treasures housed still within Wangshan Hall will remain thus neglected, deep within the mountains...! A shame. Such a shame!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Eh? Treasures!?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Quite so! Grand Master Guhua secretly established 12 Secret Chambers within the Hall upon the Clan's founding, in which he placed treasures now lost to the world.
Wangshan Hall is hewn from the mountain stone itself, and its structure is complex and intricate. Over millennia, only a handful of these hidden chambers have been discovered. The locations of many others are unknown even to us disciples.
I sense something special about you. Perchance you might stumble across one of Grand Master Guhua's hidden chambers during your visit to this historical site!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>(This has to be a gimmick to sucker tourists in...)</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>(Surely no one could fall for this...)</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
12 Secret Chambers!? For real!? Traveler, Traveler! We've gotta see this! Y'know, and those secret Guhua Clan treasures!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hey, what's with that look? Aren't you tempted at all? We'll be rich if we find that forgotten treasure!
Oh! That reminds Paimon... Isn't Xingqiu a member of the Guhua Clan? Maybe he once trained there!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Fine then. Lead the way, Paimon.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hehe, awesome! Paimon just knew that you'd be interested!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Hang on, how much does it cost to tour Wangshan Hall?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Cost? Haha, surely you jest! We are honorable disciples of the Guhua Clan, and wish only to invite those of character to come visit. We are not brash, swindling charlatans!
I'm not asking for a penny! How about it, then? Would you care to proceed to Wangshan Hall to explore our illustrious history?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Great, that's just what I was thinking!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, you certainly are direct!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Since it's free, we might as well go take a look...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Wonderful! Well, without further ado, I'll go plan a sightseeing route for you both! Please, simply follow the map straight to Wangshan Hall!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third takes his leave...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Great! Let's go soon, Traveler! Paimon can't wait!
<color=#ece5d8>Outside Wangshan Hall</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Talk to Huang the Third</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
(No... How can you take those antiques out without maintaining them!? What if...)
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
(Hey, you don't get it... If I did that, and people saw that the paint was new, would they still be willing to come play... I mean, come train!? The sense of history is... whatchamacallit... Hey!)
(...And anyway, the two of us don't have that much spare cash...)
Oh, oh... Welcome! I see you've made it to our stronghold — Wangshan Hall!
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Err... and who's this?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, worry not! This is my junior brother, known in our circles as Wen the Fourth, and by the people as the Snowstriding Sword.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Welcome, welcome.
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
However, Wangshan Hall is, in the end, very important to us. Custom dictates, therefore, that outsiders who wish to enter must first pass two trials.
Put another way, we first wish to see just how skilled you are!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Hmph, don't underestimate us!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
(Well, just look what gullible fish just got on the hook...)
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Of course, of course! These two tests will certainly be a walk in the park for your illustrious selves!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>This is so troublesome...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, no need to worry! These two tests will certainly be a walk in the park for your illustrious selves!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
It's just that these are the rules of our clan, and we can't simply change them arbitrarily. Please forgive me.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Boo... Nothing for it. We do want the treasure from those 12 Secret Chambers...
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
The 12 Secret Chambers, eh? Haven't you told these guests a lot? Did you count those chambers specifically...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Tsk...
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Whatever. Go on, go on.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
So, what exactly do I need to do?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
It's very simple. Please, follow me!
<color=#ffffff73>Optional Dialogue:</color> Talk to Wen the Fourth
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Tell me about the trials...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Outsiders who seek to enter Wangshan Hall must pass two trials. This rule has existed since ancient times.
However... Forget it, if my senior thinks it's all right, then I have nothing to say about it. Anyway, there's nothing to worry about. Anyone can pass the trials as they are right now.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Huh? What do you mean?
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...You will understand soon enough. Go on, don't let me keep you. My senior is waiting.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>We'll be on our way then. Goodbye!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Go on, my senior is waiting.
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> According to Huang the Third, anyone wishing to enter Wangshan Hall who is not a disciple must first pass two trials...
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Follow Huang the Third to the site of the trial</color>
<color=#ece5d8>Plum Blossom Pole Trial</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Learn about the rules for the trial</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Behold the Plumwatcher Piles, passed down by Grand Master Guhua!
It was upon these stones that Grand Master Guhua practiced back in the day, diligently cultivating the technique to become a true master! Over there, the ancient trees were also planted by our founder's hand...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Wow, they're all at crazy angles, and some are even broken in half...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
It's probably due to years of disrepair and neglect...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Ahem... Of course not! It's merely to increase the difficulty of the training, nothing more! After all, there won't be neat stone piles to step on in a real battle, will there?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Nobody would step on one of these things in a real fight either!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
...In any case! For the first trial, I ask that you step on the stone piles in the order I specify within the allotted time, Traveler. Show me what you've got!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Heh, piece of cake!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>This is so troublesome...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
C'mon, Traveler, you've got this! If you wanna get the treasure... Ahem, Paimon means, if you wanna pass the trial, you've gotta be willing to put in the effort!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Alright then. You're up, Traveler!
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Complete the trial!</color>
The additional dialogue appears during the trial if the player successfully climbed onto the poles.
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Simply incredible! This way next, please.
Not bad! Your skill is truly extraordinary, Young Hero/Young Heroine!
Okay! Almost there, one last step!
The additional dialogue appears during the trial if the player fell into the water.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Wah! Into the drink... Th—That didn't count! Again!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, there are no do-overs in life! Young Hero/Young Heroine‍, fret not. Whether we rise or fall, it is all but part of the trial! What matters is to press on.
The additional dialogue appears during the trial if the player don't move to the next pole.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hey, Traveler, stop zoning out! At this rate, we'll fail the trial!
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Receive Huang the Third's evaluation</color>
There are 5 scenarios for the following dialogue:
<color=#ffffff>Scenario 1:</color> <color=#ffffff>The player completed the Trial successfully.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Such extraordinary technique! You moved like a swallow in flight, with not a droplet of water staining your wings. Such unparalleled grace is truly worthy of a hero!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Heh, it was nothing!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>I almost fell...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hmm... Does using a wind glider count as a technique?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it looks like you still have much to learn about traditional martial arts, child.
I ask you this: When a wandering hero strides out and brings bandits and thieves alike to justice, was it their skill that deserves credit, or their sword's?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Uh... The hero's skill, of course!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Correct! Even the sharpest blade is ineffective in the hands of one who knows not how to wield it.
It is by this same reasoning that Traveler could use his/her wind glider so superbly. This is the kind of mastery we strive for in Guhua martial arts!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hmm, that does make sense. But it also doesn't make sense at all...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
With that, let me congratulate you on acing the first trial, Traveler! For the second trial, we must proceed to the practice arena. Please come with me!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
I won't lose!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
That's right, and Paimon will be cheering you on!
<color=#ffffff>Scenario 2:</color> <color=#ffffff>The player fell into the water.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Whoa, Traveler, are you okay?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>*sniff* I fell because I wasn't looking...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>It's all because these poles are too dang slippery!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Come on, be careful! *sigh* It's a good thing there's only water under these poles... Had it been solid ground, you probably would have gotten hurt.
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Such extraordinary technique! You moved with remarkable finesse, like a swallow in flight. Such unparalleled grace is truly worthy of a hero!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
???
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Huh? What are you talking about? Traveler fell right into the water! Good thing he/she can swim...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it looks like you still have much to learn about traditional martial arts, child.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
...Huh?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
You see... This trial is meant to test visitors against these stone piles.
But how could a few stone piles gauge the limits of your extraordinary technique? Doubtless, you intentionally went off the beaten path and dropped into the water to display your true skill...
You fell exactly above the array's core, and as you swam back ashore, you perfectly undid said array. Others may not understand these profundities, but how could it ever escape me, the Cloudpiercing Arrow?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>You are wise indeed!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Eh... Are you two being serious?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Are you for real?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
With that, let me congratulate you on acing the first trial, Traveler! For the second trial, we must proceed to the practice arena. Please come with me!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
I won't lose!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
No, but you didn't win either!
<color=#ffffff>Scenario 3:</color> <color=#ffffff>The player ran out of time.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Woah, time's up already...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
*sniff* We were so close...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Such extraordinary technique! You moved like a swallow in flight, with not a droplet of water staining your wings. Such unparalleled grace is truly worthy of a hero!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
???
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Wait! How the heck did you come to that conclusion!? It wasn't completed at all!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it looks like you still have much to learn about traditional martial arts, child.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
...Huh?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
You see... This trial is meant to test visitors against these stone piles.
Let me ask you a question. Did your companion lose his/her footing and fall into the water?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Well... No...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
And that is where the secret lies! If the goal was only to follow the rules and move about on the wooden piles, then it would have been a piece of cake with Traveler's agility.
But the great do not allow themselves to be bound by rules!
Just clearing the first few wooden piles was enough to prove Traveler's skill, and standing firm afterward demonstrated uncompromising will! An admirable combination of integrity and skill, indeed!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Exactly!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Eh... Are you two being serious?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Just staying out of the water is considered a success?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
With that, let me congratulate you on acing the first trial, Traveler! For the second trial, we must proceed to the practice arena. Please come with me!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Haha! Defeat is impossible!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
No, but you didn't win either!
<color=#ffffff>Scenario 4:</color> <color=#ffffff>The player did not attempt the Trial and ran out of time.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hey! Why are you just standing there?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>I, er, got distracted...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Oh, come on, how could you get distracted at a time like this?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Excellent! Only a true hero like you could have immediately seen through the true essence of this trial!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
...Huh?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
???
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
If the goal was only to follow the rules and move about on the stone piles, then I'm sure Traveler's agility would have made short work of it.
But Traveler stood still on the spot. Now, why is that?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Uh... Because he/she was distracted...?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>It's, uh, just really high up...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
You say that, but Paimon doesn't think you've ever been scared of heights before...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Excellent! Only a true hero like you could have immediately seen through the true essence of this trial!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
...Huh?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
???
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
If the goal was only to follow the rules and move about on the stone piles, then I'm sure Traveler's agility would have made short work of it.
But Traveler stood still on the spot. Now, why is that?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Uh... Because he/she was afraid...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it looks like you still have much to learn about traditional martial arts, child.
You see... This trial is meant to test visitors against these stone piles.
As our predecessors once said, the prudent should foresee danger and take precautions. This is exactly what they meant! And Traveler would rather give up on the trial than betray this principle. Truly admirable!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>You are wise indeed!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Eh... Are you two being serious?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Are you for real?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
With that, let me congratulate you on acing the first trial, Traveler! For the second trial, we must proceed to the practice arena. Please come with me!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
I won't lose!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
You didn't even try!
<color=#ffffff>Scenario 5:</color> <color=#ffffff>The player drowned in the water.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Whoa, Traveler, are you okay?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>*sniff* I fell because I wasn't looking...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Well, now I can say I've definitely drunk enough!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hey, that's not something to be proud of! You could've gotten hurt there! Seriously, take better care of yourself!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Excellent! Who knew you could hold your breath underwater for so long and still seem so alive after being fished out... No, you're completely fine! A true hero indeed!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
???
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
What do you mean, holding his/her breath underwater!? He/She clearly swallowed a ton of water down there!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it looks like you still have much to learn about traditional martial arts, child.
I ask you this: When a wandering hero strides out and brings bandits and thieves alike to justice, was it their skill that deserves credit, or their sword's?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Uh... The hero's skill, of course... Wait! What has that go to do with anything?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Everything! Everyone knows that holding your breath in the open air is part of the basics while holding your breath underwater is the supreme technique!
As they say, the form of martial arts is fluid, and anything can be a sword. Even flowers and leaves can harm others. Traveler's mastery, therefore, is truly admirable!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Exactly!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Uh... Nothing you said seems to have any connection with that...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>I have no idea myself...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
You see... This trial is meant to test visitors against these stone piles.
Since you've displayed an extraordinary ability to hold your breath, you've been tested sufficiently and sufficient!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
This makes no sense at all!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
With that, let me congratulate you on acing the first trial, Traveler! For the second trial, we must proceed to the practice arena. Please come with me!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
I won't lose!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
What are you so happy about!?

Optional Dialogue: Talk to Wen the Fourth
The alternative dialogue appears if the player completed the Trial successfully.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...Skilled.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Huh?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
I said you're skilled.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Thanks for the compliment.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
But you need more practice if you seek to further yourself.
I saw the way you moved just now. I won't comment on the details, but it was pretty good overall. I'm certain it will become a great weapon in your arsenal if you work hard on it.
Hah... I may say that, but even now, it far surpasses anything my senior is capable of.
The alternative dialogue appears if the player failed the Trial.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>You seem hesitant to say something...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Hey! So what do you think about my skill!?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Forget it... If my senior thinks it's all right, then I have nothing to say about it. So don't ask me.
I never expected our clan to end up in such a state... Yet there is nothing that can be done...
<color=#ece5d8>Martial Trial</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Learn about the rules for the trial</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Behold, our practice arena!
Back then, the reputation of the Guhua Clan was known throughout Liyue. But what was it based on? It was based on the spear and sword skills developed right here!
The dual mastery of polearm and sword we are known for is the result of arduous practice, day after day!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
(There's nobody here...)
(Is this where Xingqiu used to train then?)
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
This is the second trial, the Trial of Spear and Sword! Just one moment while I get the training equipment out...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third produces a bunch of dusty bamboo dummies from somewhere...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Phew, I'm exhausted... Okay! Anyway, would you please display your skills on these dummies?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Sure, but what exactly should I do?
Surely you don't expect me to knock all these dummies down in two seconds flat or something...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, surely you jest! Who could train in such a ludicrous fashion?
Take a look. Some of these dummies are dressed in blue while others are dressed in red.
The battlefield may turn on a dime. You must be able to distinguish friend from foe. To clear this trial, defeat all the dummies dressed in red within the allotted time!
If you strike a dummy dressed in blue, you lose. Stay alert, Traveler!

<color=#ffffff>Before his muscles have finished masticating the first mouthful, he has already pushed the plate of meat aside, and made a mad dash to the nearby pond, where he ingurgitates several large gulps of water...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
...Erk! Wh—What's this!?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Nice moves!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
That's... That's right! No wonder they call you the Cloudpiercing Arrow, Huang the Third! We could barely keep up...
Wait, that's not the point! This is our specially-made salted meat dish, our "helping hand in times of need"! This came from our hearts, just as you asked!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Um, you're welcome?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hehe, this is our "helping hand in times of need"! This came from our hearts, just as you asked!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
You...!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Save it, I knew what you were up to from the start.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>You were planning to pull a fast one on us as if we were ordinary tourists, weren't you?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hmph, that's right! And Paimon bets all that talk about the treasures was just to bum a free meal! Do you really think you can outrun the Millelith?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Hold on a moment! Don't get the Millelith involved, please! I'm a martial artist and a proper, senior member of the Guhua Clan! If a man my age went to jail for scamming tourists, I'd never outlive the shame of it!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
If you had any shame, you wouldn't have scammed anyone at all!
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Besides, I wasn't lying... There may not be "12 Secret Chambers" in Wangshan Hall, but the relic really does exist! We modern disciples just don't know where it is.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
What's the difference? Hmph! We're gonna tell the Millelith that you're a mean old man who's deliberately swindling tourists, cheating them out of their food, and... and...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Okay, okay! I've received a lot of tourists in my time here, but hardly any as honest as you two...
How about this, to repay you for not reporting me to the authorities, I'll make an exception. I'll give you the key to the library. There are countless secret martial arts books in there. Surely they also count as "treasures"?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third produces a big set of keys...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Uh, and these keys are...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
They're all the same, they're all spare keys to the library.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Why do you have so many spares?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, at my age, I'm afraid I'll lose them. Here, take this one.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
But if you lost one, wouldn't you lose them all?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
That's right... Wait a minute, we were just threatening to report you. Why are you suddenly giving us something so important?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>True, especially if they're the genuine secret texts of the Guhua Clan...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Aren't you worried we might actually be bad people?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
...To be honest, the tourists from before paid in Mora, which I used to maintain the things buried here.
Not that there's much left of the Guhua Clan now... The only ones left here who still have any desire to return and keep things running are a few of us old folks.
It's just a shame. At our age, we have the will, but not the strength... You two saw how run-down the place is. The most we can do now is keep the dust at bay.
Haha. If Grand Master Guhua were still around, I'm sure he'd laugh at our powerlessness.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Huang the Third...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
But the Guhua Clan's thousand-year legacy can't just be buried along with us old folks, can it? I can tell that you're good people... and good people are hard to come by these days.
Your willingness to humor an old fool like me brought some life back into this place... The way I see it, better these books be entrusted to you than left to rot in this place.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>I see.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Fine...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha... Anyway, that's enough of this sentimental talk. Let's just say I'm giving the key to you so you won't report me.
Traveler... No, Mr./Ms. Traveler, you may stay here as long as you like. As for the books in the library... Take any that catch your eye.
Help yourself, alright?

<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> At Huang the Third's invitation, you arrive at the legendary place where the treasure of the Guhua Clan is located, Wangshan Hall...
<color=#ffffff>Quest Objective:</color> <color=#ffffff>Go to Wangshan Hall</color>
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Excuse me... What is this place?
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Wangshan Hall.
If you're lost... keep following that road over there, it'll take you to Yilong Wharf.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hmm, Wangshan Hall? Now where has Paimon heard this name before...?
Oh yeah! Paimon remembers now! ... That's the stronghold of the Guhua Clan, right!?
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...Indeed.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Wow, Paimon never expected it would be in this sort of place... Well, can we go in and look around?
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Look around, you say? I didn't think outsiders would want to visit such a remote, mountainous place!
But since you're here, let me fetch one of my seniors to show you around. I'm not urbane or eloquent enough to receive visitors, I fear.
You two wait here while I go to Yilong Wharf. I won't be long!
<color=#ffffff>Even before the voice of Wen the Fourth has faded, he has turned and disappeared into the forest...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Whoa! Impressive! Now you see him, now you don't!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
So that's real qinggong in action, eh...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Wait, hang on a second. Did he just say Yilong Wharf!? So how long are we gonna be waiting!?
Well, seeing as he's proficient in martial arts, it probably won't take him too long to get from here to there...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Nothing for it but to wait, then.
<color=#ffffff>It is not long before Wen the Fourth returns with another person...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Hey, c'mon, a bit slower, will you? These old bones can't keep up with your pace...
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...I AM going slow. And let's be real, you're the one who's neglected your skills for so long that you've put on all this meat...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Enough, that's enough. Don't say such things in front of visitors!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Er, and this old gentleman is...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Huang the Third of the Guhua Clan. Some people know me as the Cloudpiercing Arrow.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Cloudpiercing Arrow...? So you're a talented archer?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, it was just a moniker bestowed on me in my youth. Pay it no mind.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Hmph, what do you mean "bestowed upon"? You just call yourself that...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Why don't you just keep a lid on it? Ahem... Anyway, you'd like to visit Wangshan Hall, right?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>That's right.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, very good! With your skills, perhaps you might find the treasures left by Grand Master Guhua!
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Eh? Treasures!?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Quite so! Grand Master Guhua secretly established 12 Secret Chambers within the Hall upon the Clan's founding, in which he placed treasures now lost to the world.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
12 Secret Chambers, eh? That's very specific of you. Did you take the time to count them yourself...?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Tsk...
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Whatever. Go on, go on.
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Wangshan Hall is hewn from the mountain stone itself, and its structure is complex and intricate. Over millennia, only a handful of these hidden chambers have been discovered. The locations of many others are unknown even to us disciples.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Actually, we were just passing through...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
I see... Alas! Would it not be a shame if the treasures housed still within Wangshan Hall will remain thus neglected, deep within the mountains...! A shame. Such a shame!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Eh? Treasures!?
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Quite so! Grand Master Guhua secretly established 12 Secret Chambers within the Hall upon the Clan's founding, in which he placed treasures now lost to the world.
Wangshan Hall is hewn from the mountain stone itself, and its structure is complex and intricate. Over millennia, only a handful of these hidden chambers have been discovered. The locations of many others are unknown even to us disciples.
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Oh... Even we disciples don't know where they are, and you're bringing outsiders in?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Brother, you... Calm yourself. Stop interrupting me!
I sense something special about you. Perchance you might stumble across one of Grand Master Guhua's hidden chambers during your visit to this historical site!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>(This has to be a gimmick to sucker tourists in...)</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>(Surely no one could fall for this...)</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
For real!? Traveler, Traveler! Let's go see those secret Guhua Clan treasures, shall we?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hey, what's with that look? Aren't you tempted at all? We'll be rich if we find that forgotten treasure!
Oh! That reminds Paimon... Isn't Xingqiu a member of the Guhua Clan? Maybe he once trained here!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Fine then. Lead the way, Paimon.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Hehe, awesome! Paimon just knew that you'd be interested!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
Hang on, how much does it cost to tour Wangshan Hall?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Cost? Haha, surely you jest! We are honorable disciples of the Guhua Clan, and wish only to invite those of character to come visit. We are not brash, swindling charlatans!
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
...
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
I'm not even asking for a penny! How about it? Would you care to come with me for a tour, and together explore our clan's illustrious history?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Great, that's just what I was thinking!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, you certainly are direct!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Since it's free, we might as well go take a look...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
However, Wangshan Hall is, in the end, very important to us. Custom dictates, therefore, that outsiders who wish to enter must first pass two trials.
Put another way, we first wish to see just how skilled you are!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>Hmph, don't underestimate us!</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Of course, of course! These two tests will certainly be a walk in the park for your illustrious selves!
It's just that these are the rules of our clan, and we can't simply change them arbitrarily. Please forgive me.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> <color=#ffffff>This is so troublesome...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
Haha, no need to worry! These two tests will certainly be a walk in the park for your illustrious selves!
It's just that these are the rules of our clan, and we can't simply change them arbitrarily. Please forgive me.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color>
Boo... Nothing for it. Guess we've gotta do it for Guhua's treasure...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color>
So, what exactly do I need to do?
<color=#ffffff>Huang the Third:</color>
It's very simple. Please, follow me!
<color=#ffffff>Wen the Fourth:</color>
Stay safe, you two.

...
